title: School Enrichment Programs
question_text:
A school district has $1{,}200$ students entering the first grade. Each child is administered a standardized intelligence test that is known to have a mean of $100$ and a standard deviation of $15$. The scores on the test are known to be approximately normally distributed.
State guidelines require that children scoring either above $125$ or below $75$ be enrolled in special enrichment programs.
How many children will the school district expect to enroll in the enrichment programs for this group of first graders?

choices.text: This cannot be determined without knowing the individual test results for each student.
